text: Neeraj Bora (born 1967) is an Indian politician and a member of the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly. He is the son of the former UP legislator Late Mr D.P. Bora. He is a member of the Bharatiya Janata Party and was elected into the legislative assembly in the 2017 UP elections from the Lucknow North constituency by defeating Prof. Abhishek Misra of Samajwadi Party. ==Life== Neeraj was born in the Shohratgarh tehsil of [Siddharthnagar district] of Uttar Pradesh. He was always greatly influenced by his father Late Sri D P Bora an eminent politician, and wanted to work in the social sector from a very early age. After completing his schooling from one of the most prominent school Mahanagar Boy's School of Lucknow, he went on to study medicine at Dr B.R. Ambedkar Medical College, Bangalore. He completed MBA programme and became a communication specialist, started teaching, Neeraj is married to Bindu Bora and has three children, a son and two daughters. In the past, he was also been elected as the Dist Governor & Multiple Council Chairman of Lions Clubs International for MD 321, and was the president of the Lucknow branch of Indian Medical Association in 2002–2005. He is also the president of the International Vaish Federation of U.P. He is also the establisher of Sewa Hospital and Bora group of Institutions, including Institute of Allied Health Sciences,Lucknow,a Dr,teacher, philanthropist and politician is rendering his services to the society from past three decades, now MLA at Lucknow. ==References== ==External links== *News18 *Times of India *News18 *Times of India Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:Uttar Pradesh MLAs 2017– Category:Indian National Congress politicians from Uttar Pradesh Category:Bharatiya Janata Party politicians from Uttar Pradesh Category:Bahujan Samaj Party politicians from Uttar Pradesh Category:Politicians from Lucknow
title: Neeraj Bora
